title: Shoulder injury forces Saints QB Carr to retire
content: New Orleans Saints quarterback Derek Carr has decided to retire because of a degenerative rotator cuff injury.

title: Red Sox's Henry, disgruntled Devers have sit-down
content: Red Sox owner John Henry flew to Kansas City to have a sit-down with disgruntled star Rafael Devers, who told the team he would not move to first base.

title: Ohtani's blast caps 6-run 9th in wild Dodgers rally
content: Shohei Ohtani's three-run homer capped a six-run ninth inning for the Dodgers, who rallied for a thrilling 14-11 victory over the Diamondbacks.

title: Nuggets rebound, outlast OKC in OT for 2-1 lead
content: Despite a game that left Nikola Jokic calling himself "the worst player on the court," the Nuggets shook off a 43-point Game 2 loss to outlast the Thunder in overtime in Game 3 and take a 2-1 series lead.

title: Dominguez youngest Yankee ever with 3-HR game
content: At 22 years, 91 days old, Jasson Dominguez passed Joe DiMaggio as the youngest player in Yankees history to homer three times in a game, doing so in a 10-2 win over the Athletics.

title: Rose (illness), Kim (back) withdraw from Truist
content: Justin Rose, who finished second behind Rory McIlroy at last month's Masters, withdrew from the Truist Championship on Saturday due to an illness.

title: Angel City's King 'responsive' after carted off field
content: Angel City defender Savy King was "responsive and undergoing further evaluation" after being stretchered off the field following a "medical event" during the team's match against the Utah Royals on Friday night.

title: Riley not sorry on Butler call, eyes Heat overhaul
content: Addressing the Jimmy Butler situation for the first time since the forward was traded to the Warriors, Pat Riley said that he wishes Butler well. He also said he expects the Heat to make roster changes in the offseason.

title: Why a Celtics series loss to the Knicks could have massive ramifications this offseason
content: If the Celtics fall to the Knicks, their viability as a group could be in question -- a stunning fall from just a year ago.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Golden Knights rally from down 2-0?
content: The Oilers are up 2-0, with Game 3 at home. Plus, previewing Canes-Capitals, and Friday's recaps, three stars.

title: Cooper Flagg, 5-on-5 workouts and prospects to watch at the NBA draft combine
content: With 120 players expected at the NBA draft combine in Chicago, here's everything to watch out for and know.

title: The NFL draft picks who landed with the perfect team: Bowen’s favorite early-round fits
content: Which rookies fit the best with their new NFL schemes? We picked out 15 who could thrive, including Seahawks guard Grey Zabel.

title: Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling -- and if they can bounce back
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: NBA playoff futures: Celtics favored to win East heading into critical Game 3
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP following Wednesday's games.

title: Salah: Slot impact at Liverpool surprised me
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has admitted the impact of Arne Slot at the club following Jurgen Klopp's exit surprised him.

title: Alonso to leave Leverkusen, Madrid beckons
content: Xabi Alonso has confirmed he is leaving Bayer Leverkusen at the end of the season, with the Spanish coach expected to join Real Madrid.

title: Pulisic leads Milan rally with goal and assist in win
content: Santiago Gimenez and Christian Pulisic powered AC Milan to a crucial 3-1 home win over Bologna on Friday, a victory that not only kept their slim top-four hopes flickering but also set the stage for a tantalising Coppa Italia final clash on Wednesday.

title: Pep: This season 'most difficult' of my career
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has admitted this season has been the most difficult of his managerial career.

title: Arteta warns fans: Finding striker will be tough
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has reiterated his desire to sign a striker this summer but said the position is one of the hardest to fill.

title: Liverpool boss Slot 'disappointed' by TAA exit
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has said he is "disappointed" that defender Trent Alexander-Arnold has decided to leave the club this summer but has backed the Reds to adapt following his departure.

title: Barcelona-Real Madrid: Why this is the most important Clásico in years
content: El Clásico is always huge, but with Barcelona and Real Madrid meeting so late in the season with a title still on the line, this is one for the ages.

title: Welcome aboard: These are college football's top newcomers
content: From top recruits to big-time transfers, these players look to impact the College Football Playoff hopefuls.

title: Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: Kevin Durant to D.C.? How major league pickleball groups pulled off rare ownership swap
content: The Major League Pickleball franchises known as the D.C. Pickleball Team and Brooklyn Aces exchanged name rights.

title: Different claims made to Pope Leo XIV's fandom after election
content: The Cubs and White Sox paid tribute to newly elected Pope (and Chicago native) Leo XIV amid a fandom debate.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, City battle for Tonali
content: Manchester United and Manchester City have shown interest in Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: 6-team mock draft: Is Ionescu a first-rounder?
content: Where did Sabrina Ionescu and the other stars on the Liberty land? Here's how our second fantasy women's basketball mock draft played out.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Vyomika Singh, Sofia Qureshi On X? Centre Fact Checks Fake Social Account
content: The government has flagged fake X accounts impersonating two Indian military officers -- Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Colonel Sofia Qureshi -- warning the public against engaging with or sharing posts from these handles.

title: CBI Arrests Income Tax Commissioner, 4 Others In Rs 70 Lakh Bribery Case
content: The CBI has arrested Commissioner of Income Tax (Exemption), Hyderabad, Jeevan Lal Lavidiya, for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 70 lakh to settle an appeal in favour of Shapoorji Pallonji Group, officials said on Saturday.

title: "Conditional" Ceasefire, No Change In India's Position On Indus Treaty: Sources
content: The ceasefire with Pakistan is a conditional one and there is no change in India's position on the diplomatic measures against the neighbouring country, including the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, sources have said.

title: India, Pak Agree To Ceasefire, Stop All Military Action On Land, Air, Sea
content: After four days of hostilities that alarmed the world, India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire, stopping all military action as of 5 pm.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: PM Chairs High-Level Meet After India, Pak Ceasefire
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates:  India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire on land, sea and air effective from 5 pm today, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri announced today

title: "Firm, Uncompromising Stance Against Terrorism": S Jaishankar On India-Pak Ceasefire
content: Minutes after India announced a "full and immediate ceasefire" with Pakistan, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar issued a stern message for harbourers of terror

title: Adani Power To Supply 1,500 MW To UP From Upcoming Greenfield Power Plant
content: Adani Power Ltd on Saturday said it has won a tightly-contested bid to supply 1500 MW (net) of thermal power to Uttar Pradesh.

title: "Time To Provide Relief": Omar Abdullah Welcomes India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah welcomed the"full and immediate" ceasefire between India and Pakistan, which has come after two days of cross-border attacks and resultant damage to life and infrastructure.

title: UN Chief Welcomes "All Efforts To De-Escalate Conflict" After India-Pak Ceasefire
content: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres on Saturday welcomed "all efforts to de-escalate the conflict", as India and Pakistan agreed to an immediate ceasefire.

title: "Pakistan Agrees To Immediate Ceasefire," Says Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar
content: Minutes after Donald Trump's big announcement of an immediate ceasefire between India and Pakistan, Pakistan's foreign minister put out a statement on social media platform X, saying Islamabad has agreed to it.

title: India, Pak Top Military Officers Spoke Hours Before Ceasefire Announcement
content: A top military officer of Pakistan dialled India just before the ceasefire announcement came, after which the DGMOs of both nations spoke, the government said in a briefing today.

title: Trump Says "Full, Immediate" India-Pak Ceasefire After "Long Night Of Talks"
content: In a massive statement after four days of hostilities, US President Donald Trump has said India and Pakistan have agreed to a "full and immediate" ceasefire following a "long night of talks" mediated by the United States.

title: "None Of Our Business" To "Long Night Of Talks": US' Changing Stance On India-Pak Tension
content: US President Donald Trump was the first leader today to announce nuclear-armed neighbours India and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire. Minutes later, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri confirmed the ceasefire.

title: "Pak Failed State, World Must Disarm It Of Nuclear Weapons": Asaduddin Owaisi
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Oawisi has raised a critical question on Pakistan's nuclear stockpile amid a conflict with India over sheltering terrorists and encouraging attacks on Indian soil.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What Operation Sindoor Has Taught Us About War And 'Information'
content: Learning lessons from Operation Sindoor is important, and that requires a degree of openness. In defence, there is no finality.

title: Op Sindoor Messaging: India's Briefings As "Measured" As Its Airstrikes
content: Precision, controlled, restrained, calibrated, responsible -- these are some of the words that have been repeatedly used in the government briefings since India launched Operation Sindoor to avenge the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Propaganda, Outright Lies: How Pak Is Ramping Up Misinformation Warfare
content: Keeping up its misinformation warfare alongside three waves of drone and missile attacks on military and civilian targets in India, the Pakistani establishment and people backed by it have continued to spread lies.

title: European Leaders Meet Zelensky in Ukraine, Urge Russia For 30-Day Ceasefire
content: The leaders of Britain, France, Germany and Poland met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy for talks in Kyiv on Saturday in a show of unity a day after Russia's Vladimir Putin hosted his allies at a Victory Day parade in Red Square.

title: Italy's Areas Of Wartime Fascist Resistance Less Susceptible To Far Right Today
content: Across Europe, far-right parties are making unforeseen breakthroughs  from local councils to national and supranational parliaments.

title: After Pak dials India, both sides agree to stop firing; top military officials to talk on May 12
content: India and Pakistan have agreed to halt all military actions across land, air, and sea, effective from 17:00 hours IST on Saturday. This understanding was reached during a call between the Directors General of Military Operations of both countries. The decision follows heightened tensions, including India's 'Operation Sindoor' in response to a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: No conditions for ceasefire; Indus Water Treaty to remain suspended
content: Following escalating tensions sparked by a terror attack in Pahalgam, India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire, halting all military actions across land, air, and sea, effective from 5 pm today. The decision, reached after a call initiated by Pakistan's DGMO, includes keeping the Indus Water Treaty in abeyance and maintaining retaliatory measures announced on April 23.

title: What role did US play in India, Pak ceasefire deal?
content: Following a terror attack and subsequent military actions, India and Pakistan have agreed to an immediate ceasefire. The United States mediated the agreement after intense diplomatic engagement with both nations' leaders. Both countries have agreed to start talks on a broad set of issues at a neutral site.

title: Melinda French Gates opens up on Bill Gates plan to give away his wealth
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: 'Armed forces remain operationally ready': India after ceasefire announcement
content: India and Pakistan have reached an agreement to halt all military operations across land, air, and sea, with instructions issued to their respective armed forces to adhere to the understanding. The decision follows a call between the Director Generals of Military Operations from both sides, with further talks scheduled for May 12.

title: 'No damage to S-400, BrahMoS missile base': MEA exposes Pak's misinfo campaign
content: The ministry of external affairs revealed Pakistan's misinformation campaign. Pakistan falsely claimed damage to Indian military assets, including the S-400 and BrahMos missiles. They also alleged damage to airfields and ammunition depots. India clarified its secular values, denying allegations of damaging mosques. This followed India's strikes on terror camps and an agreement to halt military action.

title: 'Test cricket needs Virat Kohli': Brian Lara urges Indian star not to retire
content: Brian Lara has voiced strong support for Virat Kohli, dismissing reports of the Indian star's potential Test retirement. Lara believes Kohli's continued presence is vital for Test cricket and predicts he will maintain a high average. With recent retirements in the Indian team, Kohli's experience is seen as crucial during this transitional phase, as the cricket world awaits his decision.

title: iPod inventor warns: Hiring 15-year Googlers can hurt company culture
content: Tony Fadell, the iPod inventor, argues that Silicon Valley's lavish perks are stifling innovation. He contrasts Apple's critical, high-pressure environment with Google's relaxed culture, where he believes excessive freedom breeds mediocrity. Fadell advises startups to avoid entitlement, warning that fancy perks cannot replace the hustle needed for breakthroughs, drawing from his experiences at Nest and General Magic.

title: IPL 2025 set to resume next week, franchises touch base with overseas players
content: Following a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan, the BCCI is poised to resume the IPL 2025 by Thursday or Friday. Matches will be held across India, excluding Dharamsala, after the league's suspension due to cross-border tensions. Overseas players will return to rejoin their teams, with the Delhi Capitals-Punjab Kings fixture potentially restarting.

title: 'Must stay focused': How leaders reacted to India, Pak ceasefire
content: India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire across land, air, and sea. The decision followed a conversation between the Directors General of Military Operations from both nations. A follow-up meeting is scheduled for May 12. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reaffirmed India’s stance against terrorism. Various political leaders welcomed the ceasefire.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: Go home, have dinner with family...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: 'Firm stance on terrorism will continue': EAM after India, Pak agree to stop military ops
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar announced that India and Pakistan have reached an understanding to halt firing and military actions, reaffirming India's firm stance against terrorism. This agreement followed a call initiated by Pakistan's DGMO, with both sides agreeing to cease military activity on land, air, and sea.

title: 'Common sense prevailed': Trump on India-Pak ceasefire on Truth Social
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan de-escalated as US President Trump announced a "full and immediate ceasefire" brokered by the United States. This follows heightened conflict, including India's response to drone attacks from Pakistan and 'Operation Sindoor,' a counterterror action targeting terror camps.

title: 'Would never go to Pak again': NZ cricketer after PSL evacuation to Dubai
content: Following the suspension of PSL 2025 due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions, Bangladesh's Rishad Hossain recounted the fear among foreign cricketers. Players like Daryl Mitchell vowed never to return to Pakistan after being safely evacuated to Dubai. Tom Curran was emotionally distraught, highlighting the severity of the situation, with a missile strike narrowly missing their departing flight.

title: 'Virat Kohli, please don't retire; Team India needs you'
content: Former cricketer Ambati Rayudu has urged Virat Kohli to reconsider his reported Test retirement, emphasizing the team's need for his continued presence. Kohli, a pivotal figure in India's Test dominance with over 9,000 runs, faces widespread appeals from fans and former players to extend his red-ball legacy.

title: Pak to deploy students in case of war with India? What Khawaja Asif said
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif stated that madrasa students would serve as the country's second line of defence in case of war with India. This statement follows Asif's previous controversial claims, including assertions about downing Indian jets based on social media reports.

title: Life after Virat, Rohit: Stern test awaits selectors, Gambhir and the BCCI
content: With Rohit Sharma's retirement and Virat Kohli's expected departure, India faces a Test squad rebuild for the next World Test Championship cycle. KL Rahul is crucial in the middle order, while youngsters like Sai Sudharsan are making a strong case for selection.

title: From Amritsar to Pathankot: Visuals show Army taking down Pak drones, missiles
content: India retaliated strongly after Pakistan launched drone and missile attacks across multiple locations, including civilian areas. Indian armed forces swiftly neutralized hostile drones targeting key sites like Amritsar and Pathankot. Retaliatory operations, named Operation Sindoor, destroyed terror launch pads in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Nagrota, Udhampur air bases attacked? PIB fact checks
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked viral videos falsely claiming Pakistan attacked Indian Air Force bases in Udhampur and Nagrota. These videos, circulated on social media, used old footage unrelated to current tensions.

title: Why all 10 UAE batters retired out at the same time against Qatar
content: In a shocking turn of events at the Women’s T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier, the UAE defeated Qatar by 163 runs after all ten of their batters bizarrely retired out. Openers Esha Oza and Theertha Satish dominated with a 192-run partnership before the unusual strategy was implemented, reportedly due to a looming rain threat. Qatar then collapsed for just 29 runs.

title: US, China begin high-stakes tariff talks in Geneva to ease trade war tensions
content: High-stakes tariff negotiations have commenced in Geneva between US and Chinese officials, aiming to de-escalate the escalating trade war. These talks mark the first direct engagement since the US increased tariffs on China, prompting retaliatory measures.

title: Exclusive: Indian farm girl who picked up gun at 13, now...
content: Maheshwari Chauhan narrowly missed an Olympic medal. The shooter is using the loss as motivation. She faced another setback at the World Cup. Maheshwari is focused on future competitions. She aims to consistently reach finals and secure podium finishes. Her goals include the Asian Games and the World Championship. She is also aiming for the 2028 Olympics.

title: Reality check: India stock market is 245 times Pak stock market!
content: India-Pakistan tensions: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, India's stock market has shown resilience with minimal decline, contrasting sharply with Pakistan's KSE-100's significant drop. This divergence highlights India's stronger economic fundamentals, larger market capitalization, and robust domestic investor base.

title: 'I am done... ': Virat Kohli to India teammates during Border-Gavaskar Trophy
content: During the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Virat Kohli hinted at retiring from Test cricket, a notion initially dismissed. Despite a desire to lead again, the BCCI, focused on the future, didn't entertain it, earmarking Shubman Gill for captaincy. Kohli's decision, potentially influenced by form or captaincy discussions, means India will likely miss his presence at No.4 in Tests.

title: Operation Sindoor: Army releases video of troops in action along LoC
content: In response to Pakistan's drone attacks in Jammu & Kashmir and Punjab, the Indian Army launched Operation Sindoor, destroying terrorist launch pads near the Line of Control. The operation, executed on May 8-9, targeted hubs used for planning attacks on Indian civilians and security forces. Earlier, Indian air defense units intercepted and destroyed multiple armed drones over Amritsar.

title: Which Pakistan military targets were hit by India in retaliatory strikes
content: India launched retaliatory precision strikes on military targets within Pakistan following Islamabad's latest aggression, including missile attacks on Indian air bases and infiltration attempts. India targeted technical installations, command centers, and radar sites while ensuring minimal collateral damage.

title: 'Pakistan army moving its troops to forward areas': Key takeaways from briefing
content: India reports responding firmly to Pakistan's escalating provocations, including armed drone incursions. Foreign Secretary Misri addressed the nation, highlighting the interception of Pakistani UAVs over Amritsar. The BSF retaliated by destroying a Pakistani post and a terrorist launch pad used for drone attacks. Civilian areas in Punjab and Jammu & Kashmir experienced attacks and shelling, causing injuries and panic.

title: Op Sindoor: Journalist Pearl's father sings Israel anthem on learning killers elimiated
content: Judea Pearl, father of Daniel Pearl, celebrated the reported death of Abdul Rauf Asghar. Asghar was linked to his son's murder. Pearl sang Israel's national anthem. He questioned Pakistan's actions regarding terrorists. Pearl seeks justice for his son's kidnapping and murder in 2002. He highlighted the unpunished roles of Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and Omar Sheikh.

title: Sindoor, Shakti and Symbolism: How Pahalgam payback united almost every Indian
content: As Krishna told the original peacenik of the Mahabharata—the man who put the “him” in Ahimsa—there comes a time when even the most reluctant warrior must pick up his bow.

title: Govt shows time-stamped pictures to dismiss Pakistan's claims about air force stations
content: The government addressed claims of damaged Indian air bases during Operation Sindoor. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri, Col Sofiya Qureshi, and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh presented evidence. Col Qureshi stated Pakistan attempted air infiltration at multiple locations. She confirmed damage to equipment at air force bases in Udhampur, Bhuj, Pathankot, and Bathinda. Wing Commander Singh noted troop movements suggesting potential escalation.

title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Delhi
content: Delhi experienced heavy rainfall on Saturday, offering respite from rising temperatures, as predicted by the IMD. The city's maximum temperature on Friday was 36.7 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was 25.7 degrees Celsius. Air quality remained in the "moderate" category with an AQI of 151, according to the CPCB, indicating acceptable air quality with potential minor discomfort for sensitive groups.

title: Big jump! Not just RBI, central banks around the world buying gold
content: Central banks globally, including India, are increasing gold reserves to diversify holdings and hedge against economic uncertainties. From 2009 to 2024, collective gold holdings grew significantly, with Russia, Egypt, and Argentina leading in expanding gold's proportion within their foreign exchange reserves.

title: 'Pak used drones, long-range weapons, jets to attack India's military sites'
content: Tensions escalate as India accuses Pakistan of relentless attacks on its western border, employing drones, missiles, and fighter jets, targeting military sites and even civilian infrastructure. India claims to have retaliated with precision strikes on identified military targets, dismissing Pakistan's misinformation campaign. The Border Security Force reports destroying a terrorist launch pad in Sialkot after unprovoked firing.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses world's second-richest man title to his competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Op Sindoor: BSE, NSE blocked these users from accessing Indian Stock market websites
content: Amidst escalating India-Pakistan tensions, BSE and NSE have restricted international access to their websites as a cyber security precaution. This action follows a cybersecurity alert from CERT-In, warning of potential cyber threats targeting India's BFSI sector. BSE has also advised market participants to strengthen their defenses against cyber-attacks.

title: After sharing Army's 'Justice is Served' message, Zoho co-founder says: We must …
content: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu has publicly expressed his support for the Indian Armed Forces' launch of Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The operation was a response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack and aimed to hold those responsible accountable.

title: 'Attempted malicious misinformation campaign': Govt calls out Pakistan’s propaganda
content: India has firmly refuted Pakistan's claims of widespread destruction and escalation following Operation Sindoor, dismissing them as fabricated lies intended to mislead the international community. Indian officials clarified that the strikes were a calibrated response to Pakistani drone attacks, targeting only identified military locations.

title: Pak drones flying over Khasa Cantt in Amritsar destroyed; Army releases video
content: Pakistan's military aggression escalated with drone strikes near western borders, prompting India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Armed drones targeting Amritsar were destroyed, as confirmed by the Indian Army. Explosions and sirens rattled Jammu following suspected drone incursions. Cross-border artillery exchanges intensified along the LoC, impacting Rajouri and Poonch.

title: Watch: BSF completely destroys terrorist launch pad at Looni in Pakistan's Sialkot
content: Following unprovoked firing, Indian forces destroyed a terrorist launchpad in Pakistan's Sialkot district used for infiltration. Retaliation followed Pakistani attacks on 26 locations, including Jammu and Pathankot, with drone sightings prompting alerts. The escalation resulted in casualties and heightened security measures in border regions, as India responds to sustained provocations with precision strikes.

content: the best hitters in college baseball are purely in the batter's box . the best pitcher in Omaha, Nebraska is junior, 24 HRs, 52 RBIs, .326 BA Neville has been going off this season .

content: welterweight champion belal Muhammad is ranked no. 10 on ESPN's pound-for-pound list . he is unbeaten inside the Octagon, reeling off seven consecutive wins . women's flyweight champion Valentina Shevchenko puts her belt on the line against manon Fiorot .

title: FIFA confirms 48-team Women's World Cup in '31
content: the 2031 and 2035 women's football world cups will take place in the u.s. and the uk . the tournament will be expanded from 32 to 48 nations . it's the only bid on the table, and will be ratified by FIFA in 2026 .

content: Packers head coach Matt LaFleur joins "the Pat McAfee Show" and talks about adding Matthew Golden to his roster . a dozen of our experts weigh in with their opinions on everything that went down in Green Bay .

content: the 2025 NBA draft lottery brings its annual wave of intrigue Monday . the entire league descending on Chicago and offseason proceedings fully underway for most every franchise . at least 13 teams in the lottery hang heavily on which combinations are drawn . a host of intriguing young players -- many freshmen -- behind them .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Nuggets take Game 3 in dramatic fashion
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers .

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: the battle between the national league powerhouses for the no. 1 spot continues in week 6 . los Angeles is retaking the top spot from new york, with the Tigers breaking in at the No. 5 spot . the Yankees, the Mariners and the royals are the week's biggest risers .

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: the WNBA is the first expansion team in women's sports history to do so prior to its first season . the franchise surpasses 15,000 season-ticket deposits . a lot of eyes are on the Valkyries as teeming with a crowd of fans .

content: the college football calendar is finally slowing down for a few weeks . it's a good time for the second edition of the 2025 Way-Too-Early Top 25 . there's no. 1 with Penn State jumping from no. 3 .

content: sportsmail breaks down the best card and ranks all the notable fights this weekend . the 36-year-old wants to close his career with a world title fight at the City Ground . he is at least boxing in front of his home city fans in Nottingham .

title: Collins upsets defending champ Swiatek in Rome
content: Danielle Collins hands Iga Swiatek a rare loss on clay in straight sets to move on at the Italian Open. Check out tennischannel.com for more. (0:24) Defending champion  Iga Swiatek  was bundled out of the Italian Open by American  Danielle Collins , who beat the Polish world No. 2 6-1, 7-5 in the round of 32 on Saturday. Five-time Grand Slam champion Swiatek went down 5-0 in the opening set before managing to get on the board and avoid a bagel. While the first set was all one-way traffic, the second was level at 4-4 before 2022 Australian Open runner-up Collins pulled away with the win in 1 hour, 44 minutes. Swiatek, who held a commanding 7-1 head-to-head record against Collins heading into the contest, has not won a tournament in almost a year. "I played Iga so many times. The winning favor is in her favor," Collins said. "When you play that many close matches and play some of your best tennis but lose, you learn a lot. I feel like I applied that today."

title: 📈 Lamar's Druski 'Coulda Been Records' cameo
content: lamar Jackson appeared in 50 Cent's "Power Book III: Raising Kanan" he made his acting debut in a comedic series where musical artists compete for a prize . before contestants entered the main audition stage, Jackson had to approve their preliminary audition .

title: 'Any future act of terror will ...': India's big stand against Pak
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Pak using Islam as a facade, targeting civilians to fuel division in India: Owaisi
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: First batch of government model school students in Thoothukudi shines in national-level entrance exams
content: The school was in 2023 and all the 74 students admitted to Class XI have now completed their higher secondary education with some even securing admission

title: Slain jawan Murali Nayak’s mortal remains reach his hamlet in A.P.’s Sathya Sai district, funeral on Sunday
content: Hundreds of people line up along the procession route and pay tribute to the martyr; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, Ministers Nara Lokesh, Satya Kumar to attend final rites to be performed with military and State honours

title: Time for world leaders to disarm Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal: Owaisi
content: The International Monetary Fund loan to Pakistan is international militant fund, says AIMIM president

title: State Chief Information Commissioner restrains Anjaneyulu from functioning as Secretary (FAC) of APIC
content: Through an administrative order, Mahaboob Basha asserts that the appointment made by the Chief Secretary without consulting the APIC contravenes both the Right to Information Act and G.O. 122

title: Govt.-backed millet cafe inaugurated
content: The cafe was opened as part of a government effort to promote the inclusion of millets in daily diets to help address diseases such as diabetes

title: Seven tea estates in Vandiperiyar face threat of closure
content: The management has failed to provide wages and  benefits to employees of  Pambanar, Granby, Munjamullay, Nellikai, Thengakal, Injikadu, and Pasumallay estates for the past five months, according to workers

title: Six arrested for thrashing teenager to death in Belagavi
content: The Athani Police have booked the six on the charge of thrashing to death the teenager for trying to steal from a furniture shop

title: The Hindu Huddle 2025: ‘India’s strength is in its linguistic diversity’
content: Laxmikant Deshmukh said it was irrational on the part of the State government to “impose Hindi as a third compulsory language from the Class I”.

title: Crisis intervention centre for transgender people to come up at Kakkanad: Minister
content: The centre will function as a safe space for transgender individuals facing emergencies, offering mental health support, legal guidance, and crisis management

title: 5,000 sadhaks from Karnataka to go to Goa for Sankhanad Mahotsav
content: They will participate in the 83rd birth anniversary of founder of Sanathan Sanstha Jayant Athavale at Ponda starting May 17

title: Staff shortage, delay in creating new posts plague Kozhikode MCH
content: Of the 393 doctor posts at MCH, 61 are vacant; 53 of 279 assistant professor posts also lie unfilled, and the nurses-patient ratio has reportedly widened to 1:50 against the ideal 1:4

title: Apartment owners up in arms over revised rates for drinking water supplied in tankers
content: The rates were fixed at a meeting convened by the District Collector following frequent disputes between tanker lorry owners and apartment associations over the matter

title: A.P. attracts several investment proposals in aerospace and defence manufacturing sectors
content: Two reputed companies are said to be keen on Kurnool and Eluru districts while some entities are exploring other avenues in the State

title: India-Pakistan war: Places targeted by Pakistan and Indian response
content: Places across the northern and western border have been targeted by Pakistani drones and missiles, most of which have been intercepted by India’s defence systems.

title: Kerala, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu attain U.N. Sustainable Development Goals in MMR, U5MR, NMR, says report
content: India has continued to see significant improvement in key maternal and child health indicators, the Sample Registration System Report 2021 finds; the Union Health Ministry says India outpaces global averages

title: Bureaucrats guide Civil Services aspirants at The Hindu summit
content: One session highlights way to approach the personality test part of the UPSC examination, while another deals with the dos and don’ts of the preparation

title: Bharat Sindoor MSME Park to provide jobs to over 1,000 local youth: Nellore Rural MLA
content: State government has sanctioned ₹7 crore for the infrastructure of the park constructed across 60 acres of land, says Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy

title: Maradu municipality to pay ₹3,000 extra to ASHA workers
content: The resolution to pay a higher honorarium is passed in recognition of the work done by ASHA workers, says municipal chairman

title: Pakistan announces opening of its airspace for all kinds of traffic after ceasefire with India
content: Pakistan Airports Authority announces full restoration of airspace and normal flight operations after tension with India

title: Cancer is not life-threatening, if diagnosed early, says Anantapur SP
content: Medical and paramedical staff from Basavatarakam Indo-American Cancer Hospital and Research Institute, Hyderabad, organise a medical camp for police personnel and their families

title: Government gives the nod for setting up ‘Jan Aushadi Kendras’ at all GGHs in Andhra Pradesh
content: To be operated by the Indian Red Cross Society, they will make available generic medicines at affordable prices, besides putting a check on the retailers’ exploitation of consumers

title: Tributes paid to Bhoomaraddi on his 140th birth anniversary at KLTEU in Hubballi
content: A visionary industrialist and philanthropist, Basappa Veerappa Bhoomaraddi advocated rural education and community development

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation sanctions ₹124.35 crore for sewerage line extension
content: The extension work will cover 42.7 kilometres and once completed, will benefit 7,338 families. Compact sewage treatment plants will be set up at Rajaji Nagar to curb the flow of untreated sewage into the Amayizhanjan canal

title: Government committed to eradicating poverty by 2029: A.P. Transport Minister
content: The State government is heading towards building a welfare-oriented governance focused on inclusive growth, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: Operation Abhyaas in Uttara Kannada tomorrow
content: The exercise to protect citizens during times of emergencies will be carried out at five places in the district

title: Woman uses dog to attack mother-in-law, brings it to police station to threaten cops
content: CCTV footage captures the assault on the elderly woman. The accused woman, summoned for questioning, ties the dog on the porch of the station, posing danger to the police and the public. She has been arrested under two separate charges

title: Kia India, IIT-Tirupati ink pact to nurture talents in automotive and industrial engineering
content: The premium carmaker has committed to invest ₹35 crore over next five years to support academic infrastructure, collaborative research programmes, and student development initiatives at the institute

title: KSUM showcases futuristic vision of State’s start-up ecosystem at ‘Ente Keralam’ expo
content: Range of products and solutions based on technologies such as AI, AR/VR, 3D printing, drones, robotics, and the internet of things (IoT) are on display at the KSUM pavilion

title: India, Pakistan agree to ceasefire, says Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri
content: Pakistan’s deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar, U.S. President Donald Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio also confirmed the ceasefire

title: Safe to Eat Project: 21.29% vegetable, fruit samples yield pesticide residues above permissible levels
content: Twenty-eight vegetable samples and 15 fruit samples yielded pesticide residues, as per the latest report. In October-December 2024 survey, pesticide residues were above permissible levels in 15.26% samples.

title: Hyderabad police issue alert over Indo-Pak conflict-themed cyber scams
content: Once downloaded, these programmes compromise devices and mine sensitive information, with some designed to mimic official government portals to extract login credentials, the police cautioned

title: T.N. CM Stalin leads solidarity rally in support of Indian Army
content: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi, meanwhile, thanked the Chief Minister for organising a rally to “express the support of eight crore Tamils” for the Indian Army

title: J&K Govt says fully prepared to deal with any kind of exigency
content: Assuring the citizens that there is no cause for alarm, J&K Govt requested the general public to stay calm and not panic

title: Any future terror act will be considered 'act of war' against India: Government sources
content: India declares any future terror act as an “act of war” against the country, signalling a strong response to perpetrators

title: Gujarat districts close to Pakistan border asked to keep village evacuation plans ready
content: Bhupendra Patel held a video conference with the collectors of Kutch, Banaskantha, Patan and Jamnagar to take stock of the situation and asked them to apprise the government if they needed essential commodities, medicines and fuel

title: Operation Sindoor: India hits Pakistani air bases in retaliation, after Pakistan strikes with a range of projectiles and fighters
content: Pakistani military has been observed to be moving their troops into forward areas, indicating offensive intent to further escalate the situation

title: The Wire says website unblocked after portal removed article
content: The government had issued a blocking order over one article, the news portal said, but technical constraints do not allow granular censorship without a website’s cooperation.

title: Karnataka CM to inaugurate new district office complex and indoor stadium in Mangaluru on May 16: Dinesh Gundu Rao
content: Title deeds to about 7,000 beneficiaries of the Phodi-Mukta Abhiyana being undertaken in the district will be distributed on the occasion

title: Govt directs CISF to check cargo, in-line baggage in view of enhanced security measures
content: A spokesperson for the paramilitary force said the move has been initiated following a directive issued by the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) on May 9, "temporarily" extending CISF's cover to these processes in "direct response" to the terrorist

title: Surge in cyber attacks, Maharashtra cyber department warns to stay vigilant
content: Maharashtra Cyber Police has warned people about malware-infected files targeting individual user devices

title: How did India’s national health programmes contribute to increased longevity?
content: Programmes by successive government such as the National Health Mission, Ayushman Bharat and Poshan Abhiyaan, alongiside a focus on education and development have helped the country reach a life expectancy of 72 years, up from 58.6 in 1990

title: Karnataka: Common Entrance Test for appointment of guest teachers under Directorate of Minorities opposed
content: Teachers have argued that CET is not required for the appointment of guest teachers in the Department of School Education, Department of Technical Education, Collegiate Education, and other departments, including universities

title: 7-year-old boy found dead with hands, legs tied in Uttar Pradesh’s Hathras
content: On May 8, Bhola went missing around 3 p.m. when he went to a field to relieve himself near his father, Rajpal Singh's mill, a police officer said

title: T.N. CM Stalin distributes subsidy cheques to first-time Haj pilgrims
content: The State government has allocated a total of ₹14.12 crore to provide the subsidy to 5,650 eligible pilgrims at ₹25,000 per person

title: PMK must file affidavit for peaceful conduct of Vanniyar youth conference: Madras High Court
content: Justices N. Mala and G. Arul Murugan impose additional conditions, besides the 42 conditions imposed by Chengalpattu Superintendent of Police

title: PM Modi chairs meeting with top defence establishment
content: PM Modi met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, the three service chiefs and Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan to review the security scenario

title: Petty attempt to divide us politically deplorable: Congress slams BJP for criticising UPA's approach
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor slammed the ruling BJP for putting out a social media post criticising the previous UPA government and said the "petty attempt to divide us politically is deplorable"

title: Fact-check | False claims surrounding Operation Sindoor flood social media
content: Artificially generated content, old photographs and video clips of unrelated events falsely linked to India-Pakistan tensions

title: Byker YIHA III Kamikaze drones neutralised by Army Air Defence
content: The hostile drones were detected, tracked and engaged within seconds of breaching Indian airspace, a source said

title: Watch: Palanivel Thiagarajan and P. Rajeeve on delimitation
content: Under the theme India in Dialogue, the ministers call for restoring institutional integrity and constitutional balance in Centre–State relations

title: Operation Sindoor: Five top JeM, LeT terrorists killed in May 7 strike, say officials
content: Officials from the Centre on Saturday (May 10, 2025), confirmed and released the details of the five top terrorists killed on the intervening night of May 7, 2025 on Day 1 of Operation Sindoor.

title: "Every Misadventure...": Forces Announce Ceasefire, Add A Warning For Pak
content: Commodore Raghu R Nair warns against any future escalation by Pakistan . the armed forces remain "fully prepared" and "ever-vigilant" in a stern warning to the nation . he said that since the attack, India's responses have been "measured"
